definition: better than nothing (idiom)
to chat/to depend upon (literary)/temporarily/just/slightly

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
surname Yu
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
in/at/to/from/by/than/out of
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less

sentences.english: This alone will improve the usability of your product because some testing is far better than no testing.
sentences.chinese: 这样也能聊胜于无的提高您产品的可用性。

sentences.english: It's not perfect, but it is there.
Still, saving even a little is better than saving nothing at all.
sentences.chinese: 聊胜于无，哪怕只存一点点也比什么都不存要好很多。

sentences.english: Still, even uncertain data seems better than none at all.
sentences.chinese: 不过即使是具有不确定性的数据看上去也聊胜于无。

sentences.english: Making mistakes for pursuing truth is much better than doing nothing.
sentences.chinese: 为了追求真理而犯错是聊胜于无。

definition: at most/at best
to achieve with difficulty/only just up to the task/barely adequate
at most/at best
(idiom) just passable/barely satisfactory
lit. a cup of water on a burning cart of firewood (idiom); fig. an utterly inadequate measure
to find some consolation (idiom)/to find relief in
acceptable/passable/justifiable/(of a course of action) to make sense
enough and to spare (idiom)
a tiny bit/very little/next to nothing (idiom)
careless/casual/vague/not so bad/so-so/tolerable/fair
up to the maximum/upper limit/at most
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
to serve as a stopgap/to make up a shortfall in the number of people
chicken ribs/sth of little value or interest/sth of dubious worth that one is reluctant to give up/to be physically weak
lit. to scratch the outside of the boot (idiom)/fig. beside the point/ineffectual
good and bad/most unfortunate occurrence/in any case/whatever
